TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SamlSecurityToken extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken

Docs.summary: Represents a security token that is based upon a SAML assertion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The claims for SamlSecurityToken security tokens are expressed as part of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion>. A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion> has an extensible set of claims known as SAML statements that are represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Statements%2A> property. The SAML authority that issued the SAML assertion is specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Issuer%2A> property.

Docs.param: A that represents the SAML assertion for this security token.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified SAML assertion.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.Initialize%28System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion%29> method, which can be overridden in derived classes.
For <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens, the claims are specified using a SAML assertion.

Docs.summary: Gets the SAML assertion for this security token.
Docs.value: A that represents the SAML assertion for this security token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens, the claims are specified using a SAML assertion.
Use a constructor or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.Initialize%28System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion%29> method to set the Assertion property.

Docs.summary: Gets a unique identifier of the security token.
Docs.value: The unique identifier of the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token is serialized into XML, the value of the Id attribute is set to the value of the Id property.

Docs.summary: Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the SecurityKeys property to set the cryptographic keys for this security token to protect a SOAP message. The keys can be used, among other things, to digitally sign or encrypt SOAP messages.

Docs.summary: Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the ValidFrom and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> token is valid. The ValidFrom and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
By default, a 5-minute clock skew is allowed between the sender and receiver of the security token. So, if the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore%2A> property is set to 1:00 PM, then the ValidFrom property is set to 12:55 PM.
When the ValidFrom property is set to <xref:System.DateTime.MinValue>, then the SAML assertion associated with this <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token does not have any conditions set.

Docs.summary: Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and ValidTo properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> token is valid. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and ValidTo properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
By default, a 5-minute clock skew is allowed between the sender and receiver of the security token. So, if the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotOnOrAfter%2A> property is set to 1:00 PM, then the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is set to 1:05 PM.
When the ValidTo property is set to <xref:System.DateTime.MaxValue>, then the SAML assertion associated with this <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token does not have any conditions set.
